intro: Eschscholzia rosea, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and yellow center, which bloom in early spring. The plant has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils, making it drought-tolerant. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are sturdy and branching. Eschscholzia rosea is an annual plant that plays a significant role in the ecosystem and is also used in traditional medicine.
